name: Shub's Nanna
tagline: Round, moss-covered, waist-high boulders, like a chain of islands in a verdant sea.

points_of_interest.name: The Crooked Cottage
points_of_interest.description: Beside a rushing brook of dark water is an ancient cottage of moss-covered brick. The one-and-a-half-storey structure is an assemblage of crooked angles, jutting gables, oddly-placed cupolas, and grimy, opaque windows. It is the dwelling of the longhorn crone known in local folklore as Shub's Nanna and her henchfolk.
points_of_interest.interior: A quaint, rustic kitchen and living room, stuffed with drying herbs, pickle jars, baskets of root vegetables, and human bones. Concealed behind a loose hearthstone are a pouch of 1,560sp, a Wand of Fear, a vial of Philtre of the Winds, and 2 unicorn horn bracelets (1,000gp each).
points_of_interest.inhabitants: Nanna's servants—7 silver goblins—dozing in hammocks in the attic. There is a 3-in-6 chance of Nanna herself being at home (otherwise she is foraging in the woods of this hex).
special_features: Sleigh: Beside the cottage is an unoccupied sleigh, bedecked with deerskins. If touched by one other than its mistress, the sleigh shakes and screams.
Goats: 5 silver-eyed she-goats graze the bracken of the surrounding woods. Shub's Nanna uses these animals to drive the sleigh.

points_of_interest.name: The Shrine to St Thorm
points_of_interest.description: In the south of the hex stands a ruined church surrounded by a pile of crusted black filth that resembles a slime mould. The church is overgrown with ivy and home to a venerable colony of rooks, whose caws can be heard from some distance away.
points_of_interest.interior: The icon and relics in the chapel are missing, but the epithets (in Liturgic) carved around the doorway indicate that this place was once dedicated to St Thorm "faith-smith."
special_features: Consuming the filth: Non-humanoid mammals permanently gain human-like sentience after 1d3 days. (Animals in these parts instinctively avoid the substance.) Mortals, fairies, and demi-fey enjoy the substance's delectable taste but must immediately Save Versus Spell. Those who fail fall into a coma for 1d3 days, during which they dream incessantly of talking animals tormenting them with degrading insults.
Prayer: If the shrine is re-sanctified by placing a holy symbol upon the altar, characters praying may receive the blessing of St Thorm: the ability to cast Detect Magic.
